title: YEARS Algorithm for Pulmonary Embolism (PE)
description: Simplified diagnostic algorithm to rule out pulmonary embolism in hemodynamically stable patients ≥18 years old by using variable D-dimer thresholds based on clinical criteria. The YEARS Algorithm reduces unnecessary CT pulmonary angiography by 14% compared to standard algorithms while maintaining safety.

parameters.name: clinical_signs_dvt
parameters.description: Clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (unilateral leg swelling, palpable deep venous thrombosis)

parameters.name: pe_most_likely
parameters.description: PE is the most likely diagnosis (clinical judgment that alternative diagnoses are less likely than PE)

parameters.name: d_dimer
parameters.description: D-dimer level in ng/mL FEU (fibrinogen equivalent units)

result.name: recommendation
result.description: Diagnostic recommendation based on YEARS criteria and D-dimer threshold

ranges.interpretation: No further imaging required. PE ruled out based on YEARS criteria and D-dimer threshold. 3-month VTE incidence of 0.43% for patients not undergoing CTPA.
CTPA (CT pulmonary angiography) is required to exclude pulmonary embolism. D-dimer exceeds the variable threshold based on YEARS criteria.

references: van der Hulle T, Cheung WY, Kooij S, et al. Simplified diagnostic management of suspected pulmonary embolism (the YEARS study): a prospective, multicentre, cohort study. Lancet. 2017;390(10091):289-297. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(17)30885-1
Freund Y, Drogrey M, Miró Ò, et al. Association between pulmonary embolism response team activation and clinical outcomes. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2019;200(9):1167-1175.
van der Pol LM, Tromeur C, Bistervels IM, et al. Pregnancy-Adapted YEARS Algorithm for Diagnosis of Suspected Pulmonary Embolism. N Engl J Med. 2019;380(12):1139-1149. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa1813865
formula: YEARS items assessed: (1) Clinical signs of DVT, (2) Hemoptysis, (3) PE most likely diagnosis. Variable D-dimer threshold: 0 items = 1000 ng/mL, ≥1 items = 500 ng/mL
notes: For use in hemodynamically stable patients ≥18 years old with suspected PE
Not validated in patients on therapeutic anticoagulation
Not for use in patients with life expectancy <3 months
Pregnancy requires a modified algorithm (Pregnancy-Adapted YEARS)
The algorithm reduces CTPA by 14% compared to standard diagnostic algorithms
3-month VTE incidence of 0.43% for patients not undergoing CTPA
D-dimer must be measured in ng/mL FEU (fibrinogen equivalent units)
